metadata.title: CVE-2018-20022 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: LibVNC before 2f5b2ad1c6c99b1ac6482c95844a84d66bb52838 contains multiple weaknesses CWE-665: Improper Initialization vulnerability in VNC client code that allows attacker to read stack memory and can be abuse for information disclosure. Combined with another vulnerability, it can be used to leak stack memory layout and in bypassing ASLR

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1.2').
ssvnc package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.29-5').
tightvnc package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
